info.name: Ultra Minimal Firefox
info.description:
----- IMPORTANT -----

- By simply installing this userstyle you won't get the results I show in the pictures.

- You will need to install the CTR Addon to pull it off: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/classicthemerestorer/

- You will have to follow the steps showcased in this youtube video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AryrRMt1FD0.

Userstyle aimed to make the browsing experience as less possible about the interface and as much as possible about the content with a compact firefox look.

- Address bar is retracted to a button (the far left button with a Microsoft-ish Firefox logo) and will expand once the address bar is on focus by either clicking on the button or opening a New Tab.

- Reload and Stop button are hidden behind the adress bar button. Hovering over the adress bar will uncover these buttons.
info.additionalInfo:
----- DISCLAIMER -----

The publishing of this userstyle is primarily a safeguard of the userstyle itself and to share my interface preferences with whoever likes them. If you have any questions or problems, I will try to address them, but there's no guarantee I'll answer. If you still want to try, you have best chances of sending me directly a mail to adoh.astuh@gmail.com

----- CREDITS ------

- The squared modern Firefox logo used in the address bar button is very closely based from a Ffirefox logo in this blog that imagined how Microsoft-like logos would look like in other brands: http://l8.tumblr.com/post/30066743235/microsoft-logo

- Userstyle inspired by the Google Chrome redesign concept: https://www.behance.net/gallery/Google-Chrome-Project/4456341

- Thanks to Aris, creator of the Classic Theme Restorer addon, as without this addon I don't know how I would've pulled off this userstyle and for which I also benefited by his support of answering questions of mine: http://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?f=48&t=2827985&sid=5a3fef1ce8c83cf0a3714d485ac7eb9a

----- OTHER -----

Wallpaper shown in the pictures can be found here: http://www.hdwallpper.site/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/abstract-blue-orange-cool-free-wallpapers-for-desktop.jpg

- CSS code mostly based of my previous userstyle "Minimal Firefox": https://userstyles.org/styles/111261/minimal-firefox
- Yes, I know the code is messy.
- There's a bug with the reload/stop button. They will hide after pressing the reload button. I don't know how to fix it, but it doesn't prevent from the buttons to work. Unless you want to spam the refresh button, this issue shouldn't bother you too much.
